## Usage

use RStudio Menu to create a document from `worded` template.

![](tools/rstudio_new_rmd.gif)


It will create an R markdown document, parameter `output` is to be set to `worded::rdocx_document`. 
Also package `worded` need to be loaded.

<pre>
---
date: "`r Sys.Date()`"
author: "David Gohel"
title: "Document title"
output: 
  worded::rdocx_document
---

&#96;&#96;&#96;{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(worded)
&#96;&#96;&#96;

...

</pre>



## Available functions

### Chunks

Chunks are to be used in a paragraph in an R markdown document.

#### Break page


<pre>This will add a break page: `r taghl("<!---CHUNK_PAGEBREAK--->")`
It is also possible to use inline R expression <code>&#96;`r taghl("r chunk_page_break()")`&#96;</code>.
</pre> 

#### Styled text

<pre>This will add a styled text: `r taghl("<!---CHUNK_TEXT{str: 'text', color: 'orange'}--->")`
It is also possible to use inline R expression <code>&#96;`r taghl("r chunk_styled_text('text', color = 'orange')")`&#96;</code>.
</pre> 

#### Associate text with a style name

<pre>This will add a styled text: `r taghl("<!---CHUNK_TEXT_STYLE{str: 'text', style: 'redstrong'}--->")`
It is also possible to use inline R expression <code>&#96;`r taghl("r chunk_text_stylenamed('text', style = 'redstrong')")`&#96;</code>.
</pre> 

#### Break column

Break column has to be used with a section with multiple columns.

<pre>This will add a break column: `r taghl("<!---CHUNK_COLUMNBREAK--->")`
It is also possible to use inline R expression <code>&#96;`r taghl("r chunk_column_break()")`&#96;</code>.
</pre>
